Package it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.InteractiveComponents

Class LobbyChooser

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.Component
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.LiveComponent
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.InteractiveComponents.InteractiveComponent
it.polimi.ingsw.Client.View.TUI.Components.InteractiveComponents.LobbyChooser
public class LobbyChooser extends InteractiveComponent
Represents an interactive component responsible for handling user input to either create or join a lobby. This component manages the process of choosing between lobby creation and joining, initializes the appropriate subcomponent based on user input, and delegates input handling to the subcomponent. It manages state transitions and provides feedback to the user regarding the choices made.

  • Constructor Details

    • LobbyChooser

      public LobbyChooser()
      Constructs a LobbyChooser object, initializing it with specific settings and observing lobby-related changes. The LobbyChooser component allows users to interactively choose between creating a new lobby or joining an existing one. It initializes with an input counter set to 1 to manage the initial choice selection state. Observes changes in the lobby state to reflect real-time updates in the user interface.

  • Method Details

    • handleInput

      public InteractiveComponentReturns handleInput(String input)
      Handles user input for creating or joining a lobby. This method processes the input, initializes the appropriate subcomponent based on user choice, and manages state transitions based on the input handling result.
      Overrides:
      handleInput in class InteractiveComponent
      Parameters:
      input - the user input string to be processed
      Returns:
      the state of the input handling process as an InteractiveComponentReturns enum

    • getKeyword

      public String getKeyword()
      Returns the keyword associated with this interactive component. The keyword is used to determine which component should handle the input when there are multiple interactive component in the same view state.
      Specified by:
      getKeyword in class InteractiveComponent
      Returns:
      The keyword associated with this interactive component.

    • getDescription

      public String getDescription()
      Retrieves the description of the current state or functionality of the LobbyChooser component.
      Specified by:
      getDescription in class InteractiveComponent
      Returns:
      an empty string, as the LobbyChooser component does not provide a specific description.

    • print

      public void print()
      Prints the current state of the LobbyChooser component based on its internal state and user interactions. Handles displaying messages for wrong binary choices and prompts for choosing between creating or joining a lobby. If a subcomponent is initialized (like LobbyCreator or LobbyJoiner), it delegates printing to the subcomponent.
      Overrides:
      print in class InteractiveComponent

    • cleanObserved

      public void cleanObserved()
      Cleans up any observed resources or connections that the LobbyChooser component is monitoring. Since LobbyChooser does not actively observe any resources, this method has no effect.
      Specified by:
      cleanObserved in class LiveComponent

    • refreshObserved

      public void refreshObserved()
      Refreshes any observed resources or connections that the LobbyChooser component is monitoring. Since LobbyChooser does not actively observe any resources, this method has no effect.
      Specified by:
      refreshObserved in class LiveComponent
